right now that we finished the out

how to poop in the woods I'm going to
give you my five best tips for pooping
in the woods after living in Japan for
several years and using traditional
Japanese toilets I learned something
Americans don't know squat about
squatting when Americans squat they like
to go on the balls of their feet with
their heels off the ground this really
makes it hard to balance an Asian squat
they stick their toes out and they put
their heels flat on the ground well if
you squat with your toes pointing
forward it's hard to get down low so you
pop up on the balls of your foot if you
pigeon toe then you can squat down with
your heels flat on the ground it's much
more comfortable and you can sit in that
position for a much longer time without
losing your balance it's a lot easier to
maintain your balance squatting down if
you're facing slightly downhill sitting
down and squatting for an extended
period of time is a bit hard on your
knees use a small tree then you can go
and squat down for a lot longer with
good balance when westerners sit down on
the toilet a lot of them pull their
pants and underwear all the way down to
their ankles which is fine but when
you're squatting don't pull them down
past your knees if you pull your pants
and underwear down past your knees when
you squat down there's a good chance
you're going to tinkle or dooky in your
underwear all right guys let's talk
toilet paper if you're going to poop in
the woods use biodegradable toil toilet
paper don't use wet wipes and ideally
use the RV friendly septic system
friendly toilet paper it decomposes much
faster so let me give you an example see
this pile of toilet paper that's only
one week old and you can see how much
it's decomposed over here is a pile of
toilet paper that's about 2 and 1/2
weeks old and over there the stuff you
can't even see that's about 2 months old
so if you're in a place with a lot of
rain and humidity environmentally
friendly toilet paper will be gone in a
couple months if you're in a desert
environment it's going to sit around for
a long time if you're in a place where
people hike or Camp make sure to bury or
dispose of your poo properly you can
either do this by pooing into a honey
bucket and throwing it away or burying
your poo and if you're going to bury it
dig the hole first and dig it as deep as
you can poo in the hole then cover it up
leaving poo out in the open not only is
it gross and attracts flies and stuff
but it also attracts animals so if
you're near a campsite you can attract
raccoons and rats and all sorts of gross
stuff if somebody in your group doesn't
want to squat in the Woods a good hack
is to use a 5G bucket just line the
bucket with a plastic bag then put a
pool noodle around the rim to make it
soft and to keep the plastic bag in
place poo in the bag seal up the bag
burn it or throw it away if you don't
have a plastic bag you can use a little
bit of sand clay or environmentally
friendly kitty litter and then once
you're done your business you can dig a
hole and dump it deep in there one of
the worst places I've ever had to poo
was on the tundra of Alaska north of the
Arctic Circle the gats and mosquitoes
were so thick it looked like a brown
Haze about 6 fet above the tundra it was
just insane how many bugs there are and
a soon as you pulled your pants down
they would get all over your bits and
just bite the crap out of them and it
would itch so bad but if you try to
spray bug repellent where the sun don't
shine it burns so badly so uh what we
would do is go and find a little bit of
a null uh when there was a breeze and
point your butt up wind and then do your
business and the breeze would help keep
the bugs off your bits well there's
three improvements I want to make on
this ouse next trip one uh I want to put
a tarp over the top so if it's raining
you can do your business without getting
dripped on and two I think I might bring
an old toilet seat and just nail it to
the top of this toilet and if I do that
I might convince my wife to come out and
join me here and then finally I want to
get a little bucket of sawdust to keep
by the toilet so we can throw that down
there after we do our business it'll
help keep the smell down and help keep
the fly down which is important I
learned after going to the bathroom in
an ouse in manle Alaska turns out there
was thousands and thousands of flies
down in the hole and as soon as I
started pooing on them they all tried to
get out but my bum was in the way and so
all the Flies tried to climb through me
to get out of the out of the ouse and so
I jumped up because it's really gross
and then they started flying in my mouth
and ears and everything and ever since
that experience not having flies in your
ouse has become a higher priority to me
so I'll have to go get that sawdust have
you had fun yeah
awesome
